website_summaries.verdict: A durable compression bag that can fit your sleeping bag and gear and is perfect for backpacking trips.
pros: Zippered pocket on the top for storing small items
Straps are sturdy and won't tear
Plastic D-rings on the back attach to your pack when hiking
cons: The bags are smaller than some users were expecting

customer_reviews.title: An incredible deal for a quality piece.
customer_reviews.text: Bought the medium rust for my Kelty 20F sleeping bag (not the down one). In its factory stuff sack, the sleeping bag rolls up to 10" x 16". In this compression bag, I can get it down to about 9" x 10.5"/11". That's a ton of space gained. Well worth the money and surprised it's so affordable considering it's from an established brand with quality materials and strong stitching. I also recently got an ALPS tent and sleeping pad and have been quite impressed with this brand. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: TheWrongGrape

customer_reviews.title: Fits thick 20 degree sleeping bag!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a compression bag large enough to really just hold my gigantic and thick 20 degree sleeping bag and I did not think there would be any compressing going on because I struggled to get it in the XL compression bag to begin with! But to my delight, after I broke a sweat to get it in there, I was able get it compressed a good few inches, maybe more! This definitely improves camping trips for me! I had to carry my sleeping bag folded up before becausei couldn't even get it rolled up rmtight enough for the original sack! I bought this "used" through amazon warehouse deals and could not find a single imperfection.
customer_reviews.author: WDEJG's MomTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Canvas bag can be stuffed in XL
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a Teton Deer Hunter 0 sleeping bag for a trip to Yellowstone in the fall. It is huge, but I wanted canvas. This sleeping bag fits nicely in the XL stuff sack, which then compresses down to acceptable carry-on size.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what Ive been looking for
customer_reviews.text: I bought the medium and it works as expected. For comparison, this does fit my gen 2 USMC MSS bivy and black (cold weather) with 8 aluminum stakes and about 50' of 550 in the zipper pocket. Instead, this also fits bivy, green (patrol bag), 8 aluminum stakes, 10x10 Free Soldier Waterproof Tarp, and about 50' of 550. I bet the large will fit the entire gen 2 USMC MSS with stakes and some cordage. I bet the XL will fit the whole MSS, stakes, ample cordage, 10x10 Free Soldier tarp, and 5x6 ultralight ground tarp (havent tested). This is water resistant. If you need waterproof, look for Alps waterproof version.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Not the ultralight choice but seems good for the price so far
customer_reviews.text: Seems well-constructed, makes small work (pun intended) of one of our sleeping bags. It's definitely not an ultralight item, but for the time being I'll appreciate the more robust nature. Some have mentioned the dubious usefulness of the zippered pouch on the end: one use I've found for it is to invert the entire sack into the pocket and zip it closed when storing the pouch when not in use. The zipper isn't double-sided so my guess is this isn't what the manufacturer intended, but it works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Idahoamazonuser

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I use this as our dirty laundry bag. We ordered the large size and due to the compression we can fit no less than 2 full days and 3 full nights worth of clothing in the bag and usually have room to spare. We were even able to fit another days worth of clothing in it on one occasion and we are both "PLUS SIZE" folks so we wear bigger clothing than the average couple. When we emptied the bag out it was literally a full load of laundry for an over-sized front load washer, if that gives you an idea of how much you can jam in this. Seems durable and makes you feel cool. :)
customer_reviews.author: BaneTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Alpine is definitely good gear
customer_reviews.text: A short history with Alps. I have a Taurus 4.0 I purchased way back when they were a young company. Customer service is fantastic! I found I needed a new rain fly for an over 10 yr tent. Sure thing sir... would you like the origanal color or change it up. The new fly arrive 3 days before they estimated As compression bags go, these seem so far to be top notch. I just purchased a 0 bag from them and went with an XL just cause. I don't think you will be unhappy with this compression sack. As a bonus they come in a mesh back to be used for something else in your kit.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Mattingly

customer_reviews.title: Large holds the MSS!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product to contain a complete US military issue Multi-Sleep System which includes one light mummy bag, one intermediate mummy bag and a weatherproof bivvy. I'm pleased to report that all three pieces just fit inside allowing me to close the bag up and compress them down. It's made of sturdy materials and uses the end-cap method instead of just crossed straps over the end that opens. You can really get a lot of compressive force that way. I'm very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: emaletk

customer_reviews.title: it seemed like the XL compression bag might work for what I ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to compress a double sleeping bag from Big Agnes. The double sleeping bag is massive, heavy, and with the poly fill very unwieldy in the standard bag it comes with. After reading a few reviews, it seemed like the XL compression bag might work for what I needed. Thankfully it was just barely large enough to get the uncompressed bag stuffed into and when compressed got noticeably more compact. The bag feels sturdy with good stitching - unlike some stuff sacks that I'm terrified will shred apart when tightening the straps down. The little pocket on top is a nice touch, but is completely useless for anything that isn't nearly flat and flexible.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Harris

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: This sack is great. It's made very well and I expect it to have a long life. I love the design, including the built in loops so I hook it to my backpack. I have an Alps brand zero degree sleeping bag, which is pretty big and heavy. It came with a sack that has compression straps, but it's very different from this one, and pretty cheap. This new sack reduced the overall volume/size by 27% compared to the bag that came with my sleeping bag. The zipper pocket on the end seems unnecessary. Once the bag is stuffed full and compressed, it's basically inaccessible. Other than that, the bag is great.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Package

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, especially for synthetic sleeping bags.
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome product! I have a synthetic NorthFace 20 Degree Mummy sleeping bag and it is a little large for my North Face Terra 45 hiking backpack. This product was perfect for fitting my sleeping bag into my backpack. I ordered a medium size after measuring my sleeping bag packed. It has excellent durability. I even stuffed my bag that was already packed into this one in the pictures. I will definitely order this again for a down feather bag that I will get in the future. Great product for those that don't want to spend a ton on feather down sleeping bags.
customer_reviews.author: Weston

customer_reviews.title: Good Stuff
customer_reviews.text: This has a lot of space and really solid compression. I have Spring/Fall bags and they fit easily in and then shrunk down nicely! The material quality seems really good. This is a very credible camping product. FYI I did try the small first without doing the math. No way my bags would fit in there. It sounds just a bit smaller, but when you do the math it is nearly 40% smaller in volume. Saying this just to help others calibrate. I kept it thinking camping pillows, socks, underwear, etc. would compress nicely with it.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed for a sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: I needed to replace a cheap compression sack that had come with an older (but very nice) down sleeping bag I have. I wanted something heavy duty that could stand up to being lashed to the bottom of a backpack and be beaten around over the course of a trip. The ALPS stuff sack was perfect for that. It’s light weight, but made of solid durable material. It compresses down the sleeping bag perfectly and seals the bag inside securely enough to keep out dirt and debis. The end cap pocket was more useful than anticipated. Exactly what I needed!
customer_reviews.author: Michael W.

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: These bags are awesome! Totally impressed. We bought two of them for a backpacking trip. The large size bag compressed a mummy bag that was stuffed into a 13-gallon trash bag (and a 12"x12" pillow) into a very compact and easily backpackable size. All straps, buckles, and fabric held up well over its first weekend use. Seriously awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: I love how much it compresses
customer_reviews.text: I bought the medium, and let me tell you for a "regular" adult sleeping bag from BIG 5 this was the correct size to buy, however stuffing the sleeping bag into the medium sack was alot of work. The process to force the bag into the sack actually started to hurt my fingers due to the amount of effort I had to place, but once inside, the sack was able to compress down even further. So if you have a regular adult sleeping bag then a medium will work, but if you have any kind of special jumbo bulky bag then you will need a bigger size sack.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: I bought this to strap my camping gear up on ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to strap my camping gear up on the back of my enduro dirtbike and just to have a compressed load anywhere. It works real well and is durable/water resistant enough for the money. I would suggest to the manufacturer adding a handle(s) for carrying around and a loop around the top of the bag by the drawstring when open so I could hang it up and put in/pull out any of my gear. I posted a picture of my XL loaded up. It fit two hammocks and straps, top quilt, underquilt and a change of clothes with some room to spare. When compressed it's slightly bigger than a basketball.
customer_reviews.author: Piotr

customer_reviews.title: Fits the MSS green patrol bag perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this small blue compression sack to pack my green army patrol bag from the MSS. The bag goes right in like it was made for it. It would actually compress a bit more if the straps would allow for it. As it is it compresses to fit near perfectly in the bottom compartment of the Amazon Basics 65L pack. The stitching looks good and overall quality seem outstanding. This compression sack came inside of it's own high quality mesh stuff sack; bonus!
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: Material is very strong and durable without a lot of weight. I got an adult 0-degree synthetic fill sleeping bag into the medium with no problem, and cut the size down by about 50% with the compression straps. Keeping a close eye on the seams though. They're holding for now, but I noticed a couple of weak spots with a stray stich or two along one seam. I'm hopeful they were extra stitches and unnecessary, rather than needed and misplaced. Time and use will tell. Will update if expectations are not met.
customer_reviews.author: High Standards for Online Purchases

customer_reviews.title: Holds Coleman big and tall sleeping bag nicely
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this compression bag to hold my Coleman Big Basin big and tall sleeping bag. The xl bag is about the same size as the one supplied with the tent. It took a few minutes of pushing and tugging to get the sleeping bag in. Once in it compressed nicely and is almost have the size of uncompressed. I am excited to use this on my upcoming motorcycle trip. Space matters and i think this is going to really help. The picture shows the compression bag with sleeping bag inside. I placed it next to the Coleman 2 man tent for perspective.
customer_reviews.author: G. Cates

customer_reviews.title: Works well, fits my bag.
customer_reviews.text: I've had a compression sack for almost 20 years that has served me well, but it was finally falling apart and needing replacement. I did a lot of comparison shopping before settling on this sack. It works wonderfully. My 0 degree synthetic mummy bag fits perfectly in it, and it cinches down to about as small as my old bag, but in a nice cylindrical shape instead of the old awkward square shape I had before. I haven't had an occasion to test the waterproof capabilities of the bag or use the side pocket, but it's nice to have the option.
customer_reviews.author: APS

customer_reviews.title: I own 2, Good stuff bags
customer_reviews.text: Great stuff sack at a decent price. I own 2 for sleeping bags. Purchased Rust Medium for Northface "Cats Meow" sleeping bag and fits great. Also recently purchased Grey/Red Large for new Marmot "0° Trestles" sleeping bag and it fits nicely. (Marmot sleeping fits a little snug in Medium, but it fit....) Stuff sacks are sturdy built. They compress very nicely and easy to use. Owned the one (Rust Medium) for a couple years now and very happy with it. -Dont Leave Sleeping Bags Stored In Stuff Sacks For Long Periods Of Time! It's bad Mkay
customer_reviews.author: scott

customer_reviews.title: very useful
customer_reviews.text: after reading reviews, i thought maybe the small would fit my sleeping bag......NOPE! i have two non-mummy bags that i zipper together to make room for two people. these guys definitely need a large sized bag each, but compress down nicely. the small and medium bags i returned. i bought an extra large bag and that fits my whole tent plus the tarp for underneath and has room to spare. these bags are definitely worth it, but you may have to play around to get the sizes taht work best for you.
customer_reviews.author: saibe

customer_reviews.title: Bleeds blue dye when wet
customer_reviews.text: Will bleed blue dye in rain. Otherwise it’s a functional but somewhat bulky compression bag. The fabric is fairly heavy, and the stitching seems fine, but it’s literally useless to me because it dyed a travel sheet blue from some light rain the first time it went out. TrIed washing alone in synthrapol to rinse excess dye and it still bleeds when wet. Could have ruined my clothes. Not suitable for travel or outdoor use.
customer_reviews.author: Cas

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Compression
customer_reviews.text: Perfect sleeping bag compression stuff sack. It is made of high quality and durable materials that can hold up to a lot of use. It's 4 straps compress a sleeping bag down to a small compact packable size. The sack is well constructed with quality sewn seams that will hold up over time. After reading many reviews for other stuff sacks, I am glad that I single out and purchased the ALP Mountaineering Compression Sleeping Bag stuff sack.
customer_reviews.author: Bwade

customer_reviews.title: excellent sack
customer_reviews.text: sturdy and a useful size. blue size fits my 40-degree back, liner, and inflatable pad and compresses it small. orange size fits twice as much-- I've used it for two bag-liner-pad kits when hiking with another person. havent found a use for the zipper compartment, but it doesn't get in the way. probably not the lightest one out there but the trade-off is sturdiness and price. recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Raar22

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of room for a Kelty Tuck22
customer_reviews.text: Bigger than I should have bought. I bought this for my Kelty Tuck 22. I measured the sack I got with my sleeping bag before I got this one and while the ALPS was smaller, I could have bought the small one instead of the medium. There was still plenty of room to spare with this compression bag.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan L Geer

customer_reviews.title: Best compression bag I've found so far!
customer_reviews.text: Fit was perfect for my Winter sleeping bag. I had tried several others, but their workmanship and/or ease of use were lacking. This bag allows compression of sleeping bags in two dimensions -- circumference & length -- which saves the most space. The four end-to-end compression straps reduce the length and provide additional protection for the sleeping bag. The end pocket is a handy option. Has two "D" rings so that a shoulder or hand strap can be used (not included). Came packaged in a nice drawstring pouch made of strong netting (which I am already using for other things). Cost a bit more than some, but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Nature Photographer

customer_reviews.title: Great for my Kelty Callisto 20
customer_reviews.text: I have a Kelty Callisto 20 sleeping bag that is a little bulky in the stuff sack that it came with. The large (green) version of this compression sack works great for it. I can easily stuff the bag in the sack with some space to spare and then the compression straps work to cut it down to about half of that original size. The main reason I got this sack was so I could fit the sleeping bag in the sleeping bag compartment of my internal frame pack since it wouldn't fit using the original sack. This bag performs its function very well and for a good value.
customer_reviews.author: K. Smith

customer_reviews.title: XL is big enough for most cold-weather bags
customer_reviews.text: Although I wouldn't take away even one star, the seam on one of these came undone with a relatively light compression, so make sure you test them before you rely on them in the field or your return-window expires. I've now bought three for various uses and love these. They're a little complicated because of all the straps, but it's simple enough when you fill the bag about half full to get them positioned correctly before "topping it off" with more gear. The XL is large enough to hold a king My Pillow pillow, three Florida-weight bags and liners, and regular pillows for my wife and son.
customer_reviews.author: MikeInWeston

customer_reviews.title: Handles my winter sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this XL size for my 0 degree winter sleeping bag, to replace the basic stuff sack that came with it and was showing some wear. It still takes some wrangling to get such a high-loft sleeping bag in, but after it's in, the end caps cinch down nicely. I am pleased with the construction and materials.
customer_reviews.author: Scholar

customer_reviews.title: Great Bag
customer_reviews.text: We use this compression bag for our cheap Walmart brand lightweight double sleeping bag. The two zipped together sleeping bags just fits in this XL bag and the bag's compression straps pull enough to compress it down to a normal single sleeping bag size (if rolled up). The compression bag actually almost cost more than the sleeping bags but it is worth every penny for the durability of the bag and capacity it offers. I like the color of the bag and the features but the zipper that is on the end of the compression sack is not useful since when compressed, you cannot get any room inside the pouch.
customer_reviews.author: Mommyx3Top Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Sleeping bag fairy!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome compression sack! I used an old sleeping bag from when I was younger and it worked perfectly. It was rather snug to fit it into the sack initially but with some effort, I was able to fit it in the sack and compress it down. So if you have an old sleeping bag that is much larger and thicker, this will do just fine! It really helped keeping everything in my pack during a recent backpacking trip.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for the money
customer_reviews.text: I can't speak how water proof this bag is but it held up nicely in the Rockies and compressed my double sleeping bag nicely. Seems to be made very well. Can be a little aggravating when putting the cover lid back over the top having to untangle the straps. Overall very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Covecreek3

customer_reviews.title: Compact holder
customer_reviews.text: I use this to hold my dirty gym clothes/towels. I needed something that wouldn't take up valuable space when it wasn't being used, but could expand exponentially and even when full be compacted down to save room. After about year of use this thing still looks and performs like it was brand new.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Will this hold up?
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely. I got this to go wild my new sleeping bag for hiking. I compress the bejesus out of that bag with this and it works great. This bag is great quality but a bit on the heavy side....but not too much. Plus I went camping in the rain and this kept my bag completely dry in the rain while hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Verkerk

customer_reviews.title: Crushing the volume for an easy carry
customer_reviews.text: It did the job it was made to do plus some. Added two sleeping bags to this bag on various camping trips and it made a package press look pathetic. Still going after many months of usage. My son came home from camp yesterday with it all muddy but with a wash it will be ready to go again
customer_reviews.author: Pwaine

customer_reviews.title: Great Bag for a Backpacking Sleeping Bag
customer_reviews.text: I've had this bag for 3 years now and it's been working great. The compression sacks sometimes get a bit tangled and messy because they extend all the way. I have a REI Lumen which has a compressed size of 7.8L and it's a great size for this sack. The compression sacks get the sleeping bag easily and comfortable without a lot of work really pushing it in there. I could have probably compressed it more and made it smaller in the smaller size but then it would have taken me a lot longer for stuffing it in.
customer_reviews.author: Rohan Dhaimade

customer_reviews.title: Solid Construction, Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the ALPS Mountaineering compression bag after one of our larger cold-weather sleeping bags had it's carrying bag rip on a camping trip. I was pleased that the sleeping bag was able to fit into the bag I ordered and am very happy with the construction of the bag. The compression straps are sewn on well, no shoddy stitch work and the seams are nice and tight. I was able to compress my sleeping bag into about half the size it was in its original bag. Very pleased with the size, the construction, and the quality of this bag. Will definitely buy again when needed!
customer_reviews.author: Brian D. Seavey

customer_reviews.title: Great product that saves me 30-40% packing space in my hiking trips!
customer_reviews.text: I have an old down sleeping bag that I love but it's really bulky so I got this compression sack to try and compress my sleeping bag to make it take less space when hiking and that's exactly what it has done, probably saves me around 30-40% packing space compared to the sack that came with my sleeping bag, that now has broken clamps and makes it difficult to compress as much as when it was new. Highly recommended, so much I will probably get the size up and down from this size!
customer_reviews.author: Karl E. Kristjánsson

customer_reviews.title: Love this bag!
customer_reviews.text: This compression bag is awesome. Seems to be of high quality in my opinion and haven't had in trouble with it yet. I packed a Coleman sleeping bag and 3 fluffy pillows, each about 12 x 12 in size. I placed the other sleeping bag (same kind that I packed) in its orinigal packaging for comparison. I'm very happy with it and plan on buying another of the XL size.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Makes sleeping bag small enough for carrying inside backpack. Hasn't ripped at seems when stuffing sleeping bag inside it, even though it is smaller than the stuff sack that came with sleeping bag. Misc: Bought this to shrink the overall size of my winter bag and it works fine for that purpose.
customer_reviews.author: scorlock

customer_reviews.title: Size small fits a 20 degree down bag
customer_reviews.text: The small size (10L) is a perfect fit for my Kelty Cosmic Down 20 degree sleeping bag. This sack is tough and well built, but a little heavy compared to other options. Mine measures 5.44 oz on a kitchen scale. The zipper pocket hasn't been useful, you can't get anything into or out of it when the sack is compressed. Overall it's a nice piece of gear and should last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Wright

customer_reviews.title: Useful for adding extra carrying capacity for a small hiking ...
customer_reviews.text: Useful for adding extra carrying capacity for a small hiking backpack. I have also stuffed my lightweight sleeping bag and the straps help compress the volume down significantly. Side pocket is very useful for small items. Very happy with the design and the durable materials used in the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Marco Ponce

customer_reviews.title: I liked the bag but...
customer_reviews.text: This is a really well made compression bag. I have nothing bad to say about it. I'm writing this review as a guide for other purchasers. I purchased the "Medium" for my Kelty Cosmic 21 degree down sleeping bag. The bag was too big. If you are going to put other items in the bag, the medium will be great. But just for that particular sleeping bag the Medium was too big. The only reason I didn't exchange for the small is because I didn't want a blue compression bag. That's it! Had the Rust color been available in "small", I would have done an exchange instead of a return.
customer_reviews.author: PB

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: We were storing our sleeping bags in garbage bags so this was definitely a step up. It was definitely a tight fit because our sleeping bags are so thick, but I managed to jam it in there. I’m hoping it will stretch a little as time goes on. Like I said, it is a tight fit so I’m worried the bag will rip when I put the sleeping bag inside, but so far so good!
customer_reviews.author: Mystufff

customer_reviews.title: Needed some space
customer_reviews.text: Super helpful to get my sleeping bag size under control. I was having issues with getting everything for camping to fit in my cargo box. Now I have room to spare 😊 It does take a bit of time to get it situated but I don't care it's so worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Tabitha

customer_reviews.title: I think the quality is just as good as a more expensive product on the market
customer_reviews.text: For the price these cannot be beat. I think the quality is just as good as a more expensive product on the market. If I could fix one thing, it would be a way to organize the straps after they are cinched down. Even with this downfall, I'm giving this product a 5-star rating because I still find the quality to price relationship to be very high. When I purchase off amazon, I do a fair amount of research to make sure I'm buying the best product at the best price. This product met those requirements. Would definitely purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: CBen

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Very high quality stitching and it compresses nicely. I have a Kelty tuck ex zero degree (ginormous sleeping bag) and it almost fully compresses in this sack. It makes it so much more manageable to put in the pack.
customer_reviews.author: brown876

customer_reviews.title: Finally.
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for a stuff sack for some very thick sleeping bags. The one they came with were impossible to fit the bags into. I bought 1 and it worked perfectly so I bought another. I would have got the size bigger but I'm not a fan of electric blue... I'm OCD on color... This sack is longer than the sacks the bags came with so you can roll them in a manner that makes getting it into the sack is much easier. Then use the compression straps to shrink it down. Awesome product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stuff A Sock In It
customer_reviews.text: Super durable and I'm amazed at just how much you can cram in this thing. The compression straps do a great job and are built to last. The zipper is well constructed and moves easily. I would recommend this to hikers, backpackers, or tent campers but you could also use it in the home as a compact way to store blankets, clothing, towels and the like.
customer_reviews.author: AM from WA

customer_reviews.title: Fits a 3" thick queen memory foam mattress... Barely.
customer_reviews.text: I have a memory foam topper for camping. 3 inches thick, queen size. It took quite a bit of creativity and sweat to get it to fit, but it barely fits and now I can contain that for easy packing. Something thinner would fit pretty easily. Buy with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: KO

customer_reviews.title: Fits big sleeping bags
customer_reviews.text: It fit my giant Kelty 20 degree sleeping bag. The compression straps work great. It was a great addition to my camping gear. Water resistance is not great but I wasn’t expecting it to be. It rained all day and got pretty wet. Sleeping bag also got wet.
customer_reviews.author: hopalicious

customer_reviews.title: Just fits tall size Coleman bag
customer_reviews.text: I have the extra long Coleman white water bag with the padded end flap for your head, which is harder to roll tightly. I was able to squeeze the sleeping bag into the Large sack with no room to spare; if I used the bag frequently I would buy the XL size. Regarding the 23 inch length: without the end cap the length is only 22 inches. I like having the nylon D rings for attaching a shoulder strap.
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: Great bag.
customer_reviews.text: Nice compression bag. Got the medium size and was able to fit about 3 days of clothes in (mix of early fall and late summer). Only complaint is no buckles to disconnect the straps. If they get twisted, it can be a hassle to untangle. Will definitely be buying more.
customer_reviews.author: TheKolanders

customer_reviews.title: Worked with a bulky car-camping Kelty bag
customer_reviews.text: Bought to store a bulky Kelty car-camping bag (something like the current Callisto). A large worked, but XL might've been even better: large was a snug fit. No idea on water resistance. I like the zippered storage compartment for the stuff sack's own carry bag.
customer_reviews.author: foton7

customer_reviews.title: Excellent compression bag and great value
customer_reviews.text: Excellent compression bag and great value. The straps are strong and sturdy as well as the fasteners. I used it for several month-long camping and traveling excursion the store my sleeping bag. Never gave me any problems and helped save space. Unfortunately near the end of my journey my car was broken into and it was stolen along with my sleeping bag but I will definitely be buying another one or two.
customer_reviews.author: Jason L.

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: The Alps engineering compression sack handled my zero degree synthetic fiber filled sleeping bag with ease. It's water resistant, lightweight enough, and durable for my next two week trek. The pictures show that there is no pulling apart at the seams. 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: JenandEric

customer_reviews.title: This compression bag is great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this compression/stuff sack to hold a heavy pair of winter hunting coveralls. It works great and compresses very well. I have a similar one that’s also from Alps that I use for a sleeping bag and it works great too.
customer_reviews.author: Logan M.

customer_reviews.title: Great Stuff Sack for camping or hiking!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for hiking the AT the medium is quite large it actually fit my Coleman 2 man tent and the rain fly with PLENTY of room left, here are the sizes: Small-7"x 16" Medium-9"x 20" Large-11"x 23" XL-12"x 25" Very sturdy well worth the money I recommend this to my fellow Amazon shoppers. UPDATE also bought the small size after my success with the medium love this one too its great I was able to fit my Hennesy hammock in snake skins,rain fly 9 ft tree straps and beaners all in there with some room left.
customer_reviews.author: Indaskys

customer_reviews.title: Compresses Down Nice and Snug
customer_reviews.text: I bought this compression sack in Large to (hopefully) fit a military issue sleeping bag. Nope, didn't fit. BUT, it did fit the Coleman Adjustable Comfort Big and Tall Sleeping Bag perfectly. The sewing seems to be very sturdy and the compression straps crank down nice and tight. We wanted a bag that compressed vertically and this one did the trick. The zipper on top is only good if you use it before compression. I think the price was a big high, but I like it enough and my son needs it so I'm keeping it.
customer_reviews.author: A. L. Hirsch

customer_reviews.title: and it comes with a nice little mesh bag that has its uses for other ...
customer_reviews.text: I got the extra large, and it comes with a nice little mesh bag that has its uses for other gear. I was able to fit a down pillow as well as a coleman sleeping bag rated for 20 degrees in this thing, and it does a good job of compressing it height wise. However, I will say that these bags don't do very well in terms of reducing diameter. I had to modify my pack (made by the same company) to be able to lash the sleeping bag onto it properly. No big gripes, but be aware that while it does make your sleeping bag shorter, it will not make it skinnier.
customer_reviews.author: C. M.

customer_reviews.title: Well-Made!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these in the XL size for my Coleman Big & Tall sleeping bags with the intent to use them to protect my bags while they are in storage. My first impression was that they were durable and well-made. My big bags fit into them perfectly and they definitely helped to make the sleeping bags smaller for more compact storage. I am very, very pleased with this purchase and would recommend them to anyone that needs them for a similar use.
customer_reviews.author: Lucky7seven7

customer_reviews.title: Great for Sleeping Bags!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one of these I have had. I gave the first to my friend to pack his sleeping bad in, then I went and bought another. It has worked well so far and seems to be very well constructed. Not sure how water proff it is, but I would guess it keeps the rain out pretty good. I did scotch guard it and seam seal it just to be safe. Nice compression sack that I would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Neal L.

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I'm just getting into backpacking and camping. I bought a mummy sleeping bag from Dick's Sporting Goods at a weight of 3lbs, which makes the sleeping bag a bit bulky when trying to fit it into a 45L pack. After doing some research on compression packs I decided to go with this one at a medium size. It is perfect! My pack has a separate section specifically for sleeping bags and when not properly compressed, my sleeping bag couldn't fit. After properly compressing my sleeping bag it now fits in that little compartment pretty easily. I highly recommend this compression pack.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Rugged/sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Great stuff sack that is mightier then it may appear I have used this to compress my aleutian 20 degree bag and let me tell you I'm glad I bought this compression sack. My sleeping bag would take up way too much space if I did not have this! It takes a little practice and some getting used to it. After about 3 or 4 uses I became proficient at packing my sleeping bag quickly, there are plenty of youtube videos with tips! The cinch straps on the sides sturdy and have held up very well so far!
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: Nice material. well built
customer_reviews.text: I had Coleman compression sacks but they sucked (cheap nylon material, poor seams, poor strap configuration. I got 2 of these and have been very happy. The fabric is rugged without being too heavy and the compression straps work well. I am not afraid of these ripping at the seams based on the use so far. Good end handle at one end and small pocket at the other. I recommend these (boy scout camping experiences).
customer_reviews.author: Mike_P

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great size for a sleeping bag. i had purchased and Sea to Summit "Large" 20L and it would not fit any of the sleeping bags i had. I got this for my 11 yo Boy Scout and i needed something he can do on his own. He is able to stuff, not roll, the sleeping bag into the sack and compress it down. it fits nicely into his back pack and hes ready to go. and for the price, i cant say enough!!! Ill keep the other one for his pillow!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Caivano

customer_reviews.title: Large is not what I would consider large.
customer_reviews.text: Good thing these seem to be constructed well, I bought the Large for what I would consider a standard size sleeping bag and it barely fit. My Large sleeping bag would never fit in their extra large compression bag, thankfully I did not need or buy one for my large sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Laswell

customer_reviews.title: Works for my mummy!
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be of great quality, though I've only used it once thus far. I was fairly certain that my mummy sleeping bag wasn't going to fit the medium, but it's amazing how much more you can get it to compress. I'd maybe recommend a large for a fluffy mummy sleeping bag, meaning the sack would be larger, and you could compress it down more. But my bag did fit, and it certainly conserves space.
customer_reviews.author: pollycracker8892

customer_reviews.title: Once you get the hang of it, works good.
customer_reviews.text: Upon first opening the package I wasn't sure if I would like this or how it would work. But after I figured it out, they're pretty cool. Just what I needed to tote & store our two sleeping bags (which NEVER seem to fit back into the original bag once unrolled). With this, you need to roll them up tight & squeeze the air out, then stuff the 'bag' part like you would a pillow case. Then the end caps fold over each side & you tighten the 4 side straps to adjust to the exact length you need. Has a carry handle on one end, and a zipper pocket on the other. Happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: MeMomma63

customer_reviews.title: nice product
customer_reviews.text: It seems well made and durable. I wish part of the cap was already attached so I don't have to mess with tangled straps so much. I'm sure there's a system; I just don't have it down yet.
customer_reviews.author: Althea Mix-Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing to dislike about this ALPS compression sack. I needed an extra large sack for a gigantic Coleman sleeping bag I bought and the ALPS sack did the job beautifully. Would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Peapod

customer_reviews.title: Well made compression sack for compressing gear such as clothing, pillow or sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: Quality/thick fabric yet product is still lighweight. Bough this to fit a "Kelty Mistral 40" sleeping bag and have the ability to compress it into a smaller shape. The straps are sturdy and no concerns thus far of sewed seams ripping. Well made. The end zippered pocket is nice for a sleeping back liner or inflatable camp pillow.
customer_reviews.author: Leasa

customer_reviews.title: Compresses the uncompressible
customer_reviews.text: Awesome bag to compress my not so awesome sleeping bag. This sleeping bag of mine is your typical Walmart brand mummy bag. It's big, bulky, and not light or compressible with easy, but I managed to pack it in this bag and easily get all the cords pulled all the way down, creating a solid ball. This clipped onto my pack with ease, though it would be nice if there was a clip on both ends rather than on only one so that I could clip this on easier. It worked really well though. Now to think about replacing this sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: Dave BTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: You want this compression bag.
customer_reviews.text: A great well made medium compression bag with carry strap. It holds a lot and light weight. Wether for a overnite stay, camping trip, the beach or extra clothes in your car or truck in case. This is the one.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bags run large- size down
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the small one for my Kelty Cosmic Down 20-Degree Sleeping Bag, Extra Long (also ordered from Amazon). This bag tends to be a little larger/heavier than your average 20 degree down bag, but it fits well in the small sized compression bag. (I'd guess it might need a medium in other brands.) I was able to fit both the compressed sleeping bag and my hammock in the sleeping bag portion of my hiking bag, which was extremely convenient. The straps seem sturdy and the sack compresses fairly well. The handle on the closed end is nice for when you're trying to unstuff your sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: Wedge

customer_reviews.title: Sleeping Bag Fits
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned if my backpack sleeping bag would fit and how light it would be. I am 6'1 and my bag fit well in this compression pack. Great fine.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: The best!  Quality in every detail for a very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: This is the real deal in compression bags. Go cheaper if you're going to be very easy on your gear, but if you care about what you're putting inside this bag, and need to rely on it's safety and reliability, Alps is the way to go. This is one tough product which also maintains some attractiveness. The "D" rings are invaluable.
customer_reviews.author: C B Murdock

customer_reviews.title: Easily holds 2 sleeping bags; show her you truly love her!
customer_reviews.text: I got the medium, but it was too big for my Kelty Backcountry Bed (synthetic down). Was going to return it, but the smaller bag costs more (?). But then I had an awesome idea. This bag perfectly holds my sleeping bag and my wife's Kelty synthetic down bag, and compressed, it fits perfectly into the sleeping bag compartment of my (of course) backpack! Less weight on her back = more miles on her feet :)
customer_reviews.author: Jeff D. Fennell

customer_reviews.title: Great personal travel bag
customer_reviews.text: This items fully open fits within personal bag, for flying, restrictions. I can fit a weeks worth of warm weather clothes or a full 2/3mm wetsuit.
customer_reviews.author: joshua geltrude

customer_reviews.title: Two thumbs up!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly haven’t tested the waterproof part, but this is a great compression bag. At first I thought too big of a size, but it’s actually perfect for my needs. It works well and has hooks for easily attaching it to things.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Hoang

customer_reviews.title: Way beter quality than i expected!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is really nice. The material seems super durable and the straps cinch down really tight and stay put. The orange one is the perfect size for a synthetic fill 3 season sleeping bag. I also like the fact that I can keep my inflatable pillow in the zippered pocket and it takes up less space.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Hartsell

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: As some of the reviews have already stated, you'd be amazed how much you can put in these. I travel overseas for work and have very limited room for personal luggage. I recently did a trip with just a small rucksack because I was able to get a winter jacket, 3 days of clothes, a rain coat and a hikers towel into the blue size ALPS small bag and still had room for a little more. I will be ordering another larger one soon. All the materials are tough and well made and shipping was easy. Very pleased all around.
customer_reviews.author: Reilly

customer_reviews.title: Used to compress sleeping bag on a recent Kilimanjaro attempt ...
customer_reviews.text: Used to compress sleeping bag on a recent Kilimanjaro attempt. I had the X-Large version and was able to fit my sleeping bag and sleeping bag liner in there without too much effort. My boyfriend had the medium size and was able to fit the same sleeping bag in there but with more effort. When determining size it's important to consider what shape will pack easier in your bag. Larger size is more round while smaller sizes are smaller in radius but relatively longer. Also important to consider sleeping bag material and how compressible the sleeping bag is. Ours were synthetic material and not the higher end down ultra-light bags so took up more space and required larger compression sacks.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Z

customer_reviews.title: Compresses down alot. Durable and high quality.
customer_reviews.text: I used this for a REI sleeping bag I bought that didn't come with a compression sack and now I may be replacing my other sacks with these. It compresses things a lot and if you are a backpacker like me who packs way to much stuff the added space is great!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Westwood

customer_reviews.title: Liked it, so I ordered a second
customer_reviews.text: Seems sturdy and should last. Good balance for value and functionality. I bought one to inspect it and quickly ordered a second one. I was concerned about quality based on a small number of other reviews where they said it ripped on them. Assuming the other folks did not get a faulty product, I would assume that they were guerrilla tighten the compression bag. It does have limits, but this is true of rope and chain (read the label). Eventually it will fail under enough pressure. Treat the compression sack right and it should treat you right.
customer_reviews.author: P Phelps

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my 9 x 15 inch stuffed sleeping bag!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Kelty Dualist 33 Deg 550 Thermadri Women's Regular backpacking sleeping bag on Amazon and wanted a good stuff bag. This bag is a good fit with a little room to spare for a pillow, jacket, or something. The pictures show the medium size stuff sack with my sleeping bag alone inside. Happy trails and adventures! Four stars because I have yet to put some wear 'n' tear on it!
customer_reviews.author: J Peart

customer_reviews.title: This does a much better than the original by containing it in a much ...
customer_reviews.text: Years ago lost my original sleeping bag holder. This does a much better than the original by containing it in a much more compact fashion. Product appears well made. No issues this far, and have used it 3 or 4 times. I ordered the large (olive) for an adult semi- rectangular or semi- mummy sleeping bag and it does the trick.
customer_reviews.author: eric howley

customer_reviews.title: Great durability but too heavy.
customer_reviews.text: If you don’t care about weight and are more concerned with durability then this is the sack for you, but if not there are other lighter sacks on the market. It is nice though.
customer_reviews.author: Codey Mac

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy compression sack
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to fit winter clothes in my backpack for a trip. I like the durability of the material, the ease of compression, the "D" rings on top, and the drawstring opening. I did not use the zippered pocket. I dislike not being able to compress the load down past a certain point, good if you fill the sack, worthless it you need to carry a small load.
customer_reviews.author: M Ellis

customer_reviews.title: really great!
customer_reviews.text: I just returned from a trip that I only carried a small carry-on bag and these were absolutely wonderful! I was able to squish my clothes for a week into on and I bought a second for my small down pillow, sleeping sheet/bag and flannel nightgown.
customer_reviews.author: rural girl

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Used for bulky jacket, gloves and items for ski trip. Solid four point compression. Has a D ring on each end, perfect for attaching to almost anything. Didnt use the small zipper on the end, however it seems handy for keys.
customer_reviews.author: H Y B G

customer_reviews.title: Can fit more that you think...
customer_reviews.text: Great product. The straps seem durable and they will fit more than you think if you Hulk that sucker down. Once you get your gear inside (i.e. clothes, sleeping bags, camping pillows, coats, etc) it is best to pull down the opposite straps at the same time until you feel resistance. Repeat for the other side. Stuff in the excess under the hood. Put you knee on top and start Hulking that baby down doing the opposite strap thing. Repeat the tuck in and go back to Hulking. I was suprised at how much stuff can get compressed so far.
customer_reviews.author: K&A Wags

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: The materials here, especially the gray part that the straps are bound to, are heavy and bulky. Then, the length of those parts take away so much space from what you could be compressing down if the straps extended further. Waste of money. I was way more impressed with the cheap imported Bluefield/Lixada bags. Two stars for the neat little zipper pocket - that was the only plus.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Scouts
customer_reviews.text: My son needed something to make his sleeping bag more compact for Scout campouts. This has worked awesome on his Coleman 3-in-1. It’s durable, thus far, and I like that it has places to hook it to his backpack with D-rings. I may get the rest of us some, to save space on camping trips!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Furtado

customer_reviews.title: The most invaluable item in my backpacking rig.
customer_reviews.text: I cannot begin to express how valuable of an item this is for any backpacker. I never realized how much space that I was wasting until I purchased one of these compression bags. With a size small I was able to fir not only my REI down mummy bag, but also two shirts, three socks, a pair of pants, as well as some random night time toiletries/items. At first you're like, no way, this sleeping bag won't go all the way in, but then it does and with some room to spare. Hands down one of my best impulse buys of 2014.
customer_reviews.author: illuminator77

customer_reviews.title: A good quality bag
customer_reviews.text: A good quality bag. Made of sturdy, but lightweight materials. I purchased to use with a Down Sleeping Bag and it was able to stuff completely in and cinch down completely. The size of the bag when compressed is about the size of large Grapefruit, thus helping to gain a large amount of space back in my 55L pack! If you are looking for a good quality construction Compression Sack without breaking the bank or being too heavy, this is it!
customer_reviews.author: Pack and Paddle Fool

customer_reviews.title: The bag is great, no complaints on the quality
customer_reviews.text: The bag is great, no complaints on the quality. However, if you were hoping this would hold a double sleeping bag, IT WILL NOT. I ordered an XL hopeful that my double sleeping bag would fit in one piece and unfortunately found that a second bag will still be necessary. I plan to keep this bag and separate my sleeping bags to pack individually. Packing a single sleeping bag in this XL bag was a breeze and I am over fighting with the tight bags that the sleeping bags originally came with.
customer_reviews.author: Candice Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: Too big for my down bag.
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box i knew this was a big bag. I have aand it is more than enough. I have the straps cinched all the way down and still can squeeze it a bit more, I could put maybe a pair of pants and a shirt in there with it. With the bag squished all the way down it is just about the same size as the bag the sleeping bag came in. I will definitely use it, I may just buy the small and see how that works also. The bag seems well built, but I haven't put it to task yet either. I'm happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: R. Whitehead

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff sack!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after my daughter lost the stuff sack for her coleman cold-weather sleeping bag. Unfortunately, the sleeping bag is designed for a stuff-sack and cannot be easily rolled, so I needed a stuff sack. Her bag fits nicely into the largest size. When I pulled the compression tabs I discovered that it can double very nicely as a stool for around the camp-fire! Quite a nice bonus! It also has loops for a shoulder-strap (not included) or attaching to a back-pack. The little zip pouch on the end is also nice!
customer_reviews.author: Momoftwo

product_meta.title: ALPS Mountaineering Compression Stuff Sack
feature_bullets: Top lid with zippered pocket to keep small items easily accessible
Zippered pocket reverses to become storage pouch
Bottom webbing grab handles with d-rings allows easy carrying and multiple attachment options
Lightweight polyester ripstiop with bartacked stress points
Diameter 9" Length 20" Capacity 1272 in³/20L Weight 10 oz Color Rust

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
